column4: hello i just bought a sony cyber-shot dsc-w50, but i'm not able to mount it, the usbview shows it on red but still can't mount it
You need to get a memory stick, some camera have USB plug in and doesn't show anything.. My camera have a memory card, I can plug the memory card and it's works good..
i thought it may be that. but wasn't so sure, the memory sticks comes next week :( thanks so much for the tip
if you have a sony lappy, it'll work auto detecting a memory stick on gnome desktop..
i have an old toshiba :(, although i dont have memory stick is has internal memory, wouldn't it work?
what kind of your digital camera you have now?
Oh, a sony camera you can get the USB memory stick reader and buy a stick, cuz the gnome have automatically mounting a USB flash drive and memory card..

i had and old cybershot and i was able to mount it as an usb-storage, the new one on windows this worked out of the box without installing anything but on linux it doesn't, and the usbview show its there but in red
your older toshiba lappy might not work, they'r need 1.1 and above, so the linux would override to full 2.0
or you can get USB 2.0 pcimca card..
will try it that way then
kernel: [4306998.656000]  usb 1-2: new full speed USB device using uhci_hcd and address 4
aha! that's good, it's override to full 2.0

grab a USB memory stick reader and memory stick, put your memory stick into camera and take a pics and when you're done and pull the stick out of camera, and plug the stick into USB memory reader, it'll auto detecting and auto start gthumb program to see a pics on your memory card.
